channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Is RFK Jr.'s Administration for a Healthy America — AHA — in the works or not?
item.description: The Administration for a Healthy America is RFK Jr.'s plan to tackle chronic disease, addiction and other persistent problems. But so far it's not being set up like previous new agencies.
item.content:encoded:
The Administration for a Healthy America is RFK Jr.'s plan to tackle chronic disease, addiction and other persistent problems. But so far it's not being set up like previous new agencies.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Events in Minneapolis show how immigration enforcement has changed. What's the impact?
item.description: Minneapolis is at the center of sweeping, evolving federal immigration push. It demonstrates how different immigration enforcement is under Trump's second administration - and raises questions about the lingering effects on local communities and law enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
Minneapolis is at the center of sweeping, evolving federal immigration push. It demonstrates how different immigration enforcement is under Trump's second administration - and raises questions about the lingering effects on local communities and law enforcement.

(Image credit: Adam Gray/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: They quit their day jobs to bet on current events. A look inside the prediction market mania
item.description: Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump's second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry's bonanza.
item.content:encoded:
Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump's second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry's bonanza.

(Image credit: Evan Frost for NPR and Meredith Nierman/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Major plumbing headache haunts $13 billion U.S. carrier off the coast of Venezuela
item.description: The crew of USS Ford is struggling to handle sewage problems on board the Navy's newest carrier.
item.content:encoded:
The crew of USS Ford is struggling to handle sewage problems on board the Navy's newest carrier.

(Image credit: Paige Brown)
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Trump is threatening to cut funding from sanctuary cities. Here's what to know
item.description: President Trump says he's cutting federal money to sanctuary cities. But courts have blocked similar moves, ruling that the federal government can't use funding to coerce state and local governments.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he's cutting federal money to sanctuary cities. But courts have blocked similar moves, ruling that the federal government can't use funding to coerce state and local governments.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Judge rules immigration officers in Minneapolis can't detain peaceful protesters
item.description: Officers in the Minneapolis-area participating in a U.S. immigration enforcement operation can't detain or tear gas peaceful protesters who aren't obstructing authorities, a judge ruled Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Officers in the Minneapolis-area participating in a U.S. immigration enforcement operation can't detain or tear gas peaceful protesters who aren't obstructing authorities, a judge ruled Friday.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Justice Department opens investigation into Minnesota governor and Minneapolis mayor
item.description: Federal prosecutors are investigating Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey. In response to the news, Frey said in a social media post: "I will not be intimidated."
item.content:encoded:
Federal prosecutors are investigating Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey. In response to the news, Frey said in a social media post: "I will not be intimidated."

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: No sign of new protests in Iran as a hard-line cleric calls for executions
item.description: A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ICE surge sparks fear and resistance in Minneapolis
item.description: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.content:encoded: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Measles is spreading fast in S.C. Here's what it says about vaccine exemptions
item.description: More than 550 people have contracted measles in Spartanburg County, S.C., in a fast-growing outbreak. Like a majority of U.S. counties, nonmedical exemptions to school vaccination are also rising.
item.content:encoded:
More than 550 people have contracted measles in Spartanburg County, S.C., in a fast-growing outbreak. Like a majority of U.S. counties, nonmedical exemptions to school vaccination are also rising.

(Image credit: Ken Ruinard)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy
